settings.text: A fashion and celebrity stylist with twenty-five years’ experience, Gayle Rinkoff certainly knows how to put a great look together. Like us, she believes in choosing clothes that bring about feelings of joy and happiness. Read on to find out more about her feel-good approach to dressing.

settings.title: How would you describe the Chinti & Parker woman?
settings.text: She’s me! And also, my friends. She’s like every member of our office, to be honest. The customer is diverse and there is something in the collection for everyone. From the cashmere neutrals in essentials to the more vibrant pieces that express fun and personality.

settings.title: What are your favourite pieces from the AW19 collection?
settings.text: I’ve worn the Charleston floral dress quite a lot and always get compliments and people asking where it is from. The colour-block shirt and the Eccentric pieces are great, and the Luxury jumper feels amazing on. I am also in the process of acquiring every single piece from the Essentials collection , it’s all beautiful.

settings.grid-content:
How would you describe your style?
I have a distinct boho style but that does tend to work better in the summer months. In the winter I just love to be warm and cosy, but also stylish, so tend to wear a cashmere sweater with either jeans, dungarees, or a good pair of trousers.

How has the pandemic affected the way you shop for clothes? And the way you dress from day to day?
I have considered my purchases more than ever during the pandemic and really think about what I wear, where I am going and the cost of an item per wear. I do invest in my wardrobe so I like it to work hard for me. I started off wearing tracksuits and sweatshirts but now I get dressed as if I am going to work most days. I find I am more productive when I am fully dressed and made up.

What are you looking forward to wearing this spring / summer?
Dresses, dresses, and more dresses!

Which three pieces from your wardrobe do you rely on most?
My dungarees, my cashmere tracksuit (it goes on most evenings when I get home) and my boho dresses which I can wear in the summer and autumn.

What is your most prized fashion possession?

My Chanel engagement ring, which is in the shape of a tiny, delicate bow. I loved it when I first saw it and now get to look at it every day.

Which Chinti & Parker pieces do you have your eye on this season?
I love the colourful pieces that Chinti do every season. This season I especially love the Oversized Floral Intarsia Cotton Sweater and the Mango Stripe Sun Dress. I believe clothes should bring you joy and there is nothing better than wearing a fabulous item that makes you feel happy.

As a stylist, do you have any thoughts around what people will be wearing when we return to ‘normal’ life?
From the few conversations I have had while out and about, I get the impression that everyone is desperate to dress up and party. I know I am, and even though I am not convinced I will last a whole evening in heels, I will be going all out with the frocks.

settings.title: What advice would you give to someone in a creative rut?
settings.text: You can’t force it. It’s really difficult to always remain your most creative when it’s your job and you need to channel it constantly, whilst also picking up on the unavoidable day to day aspects that are less creative, and more admin based. You are constantly switching your brain from one thing to the other. Because I work in fashion, if I want to be inspired, I have to step away from it. My advice is to read a book, see an exhibition, watch an inspiring film or just get out of your routine and have a change of scenery. As a designer, there are always times when you don’t know how you are going to find the inspiration for the next season, but it always comes together in the end.

settings.title: What words do you live by?
settings.text: Treat others as you would like to be treated.
